Retinal photocoagulation includes treatment for diabetic retinopathy, other causes of retinal neovascularization or retinal oedema, retinal breaks, central serous retinochoroidopathy, subretinal neovascular membranes, small retinal tumours, angiomas, etc. Argon green laser is the most widely used but other lasers are increasingly being used as substitutes in certain situations. o If you know the mechanism of action of various lasers, you can easily understand their usei) Nd: YAG laser is used to create holes e. g. posterior capsulotomy, irototomy. ii) Excimer laser has cutting power, used to take different types of cut on cornea for refractive surgeries. iii) Argon, diode and krypton lasers are used to create bums, i. e. photocoagulation.

question: Refractive surgery most commonly performed for myopia -
exp: Ans. is 'b' i. e., LASIKTreatment of myopiao Treatment includes non-surgical or surgical methods. Non-surgical: - Most commonly used method for treatment of myopia is correction by concave (divergent or minus) lens. These may be spectacles (most commonly used method for low myopia i. e., < -3D) or contact lens. Keep in mind that though most commonly used method is spectacles, the preferred treatment is contact lens. Refractive surgery: - The most common procedures are performed with an excimer laser. LASIK is the most commonly used procedure. Orthokeratology: - is a non-surgical procedure where special contact lenses are worn that slowly reshape the cornea over time to correct myopia. o High myopia is defined as myopia > -6 D. Treatment of choice for high myopia is contact lens. LASIK is an alternative.
